Title: Clockwork Angel :Infernal Devices 1
Author: ক্যাসান্ড্রা ক্লেয়ার
Summary:
Summary of the Book

Sixteen-year-old Tessa Grey travels to London to find her brother during the reign of Queen Victoria. She journeys to the world below London, a world full of vampires, warlocks and other supernatural beings. This is Downworld, where the Shadowhunters fight against the demons and maintain law and order. Tessa is soon captured by the mysterious Dark Sisters who tell her that she is also one of them, a Downworlder. She has the power to transform at will into another person. Before she has a chance to control her powers, she discovers that there is someone who will do anything to claim it for himself by marrying her. Tessa will need to work with the Shadowhunters if she wants any chance of saving her brother, but she is soon caught between two close friends. The fragile Jem and the blue-eyed Will, both of whom begin to harbour feelings for her.

About Cassandra Clare

Cassandra Clare is an American urban fantasy and young adult fiction writer. She is best known for writing the Mortal Instruments series comprising of City of Bones, City of Ashes, City of Glass, City of Fallen Angels, City of Lost Souls and City of Heavenly Fire.

Cassandra Clare is working on her next thrilling fantasy novel with Holly Black, telling the adventures of a young magician called Callum Hunt. Keep a watch out for its release on September 9, 2014.

Series Reading Order

Shadowhunters, this is the first book in the series. The story continues in Clockwork Prince and Clockwork Princess.

Title: Infernal Devices 3 : Clockwork Princess
Author: ক্যাসান্ড্রা ক্লেয়ার
Summary:
Summary of the Book

Tessa Gray's joy at her wedding is shortlived as evil automatons abduct her. She is a vital ingredient in the Clockwork Prince's plan to destroy the Shadowhunters. Jem and Will are ready to do anything to save her, but Will struggles with his own feelings for her even though she is engaged to Jem. In a race against time, Will must risk everything to save both his closest friend and the girl he loves. And Tessa must come to terms with her own abilities for once she does, she might become more powerful than she ever imagined. The first book in The Infernal Devices is Clockwork Angel and the second book is Clockwork Prince.

About Cassandra Clare

Judith Rumelt, better known as Cassandra Clare, is an American writer. She is best known for her Mortal Instruments series. Ms. Clare rose to internet fame through her fan-fiction before releasing her first original novel The City of Bones.

Title: The Power of Five : Night Rise
Author: অ্যান্টনি হরোউইটয্
Summary:
Summary of the Book

Scott and Jamie Tyler are all of fourteen years old. The twins don’t know where they have come from or even who they are. They use their extraordinary powers to make a living, staging an elaborate mind-reading act in a third-rate theatre. When Scott is kidnapped by a clandestine corporation called Nightrise and Jamie is accused of murder, their lives tumble downhill. Now they must depend on their incredible powers for survival.

About Anthony Horowitz

Anthony Horowitz is an English novelist and screenwriter. He is best known for The Diamond Brothers series and the Alex Rider series.

This series is alternately known as The Gatekeepers.

Series Reading Order

The story continues in Necropolis.
Book_Title: The Power of Five : Night Rise

Title: The Mortal Insrtuments 4: City of Fallen Angels
Author: ক্যাসান্ড্রা ক্লেয়ার
Summary:
Summary of the Book

The Mortal War is over, and Clary Fray finally has a chance to settle down to a life of her own. She is back home in New York and trains to become a Shadowhunter. Her mother is marrying the man she loves and Clary can finally have the romantic relationship she has always desired with Jace. However, she learns that there is always a price. Someone is threatening the peace between the Downworlders and the Shadowhunters by murdering Shadowhunters. Simon, Clary’s best friend, has problems of his own. He leaves home after telling his mother he’s a vampire. He has to learn how to deal with his powers as soon as he can, for the world is at stake. Clary has other problems as well, for Jace is beginning to pull away from her without explaining why. What she discovers is that her own actions have set into motion a series of events which may cost her everything she loves.

About Cassandra Clare

Cassandra Clare is an American urban fantasy and young adult fiction writer. She is best known for writing the Mortal Instruments series. She has also written The Infernal Devices series, comprising of Clockwork Angel, Clockwork Prince and Clockwork Princess.

Cassandra Clare is working on her next thrilling fantasy novel with Holly Black, telling the adventures of a young magician called Callum Hunt. Keep a watch out for its release on September 9, 2014.

Series Reading Order

Shadowhunters, this is the fourth book in the series, following City of Bones, City of Ashes and City of Glass. The story continues in City of Lost Souls and City of Heavenly Fire.
Book_Title: The Mortal Insrtuments 4: City of Fallen Angels

Title: Alex Rider Mission 1: Stormbreaker
Author: অ্যান্টনি হরোউইটয্
Summary:
Summary Of The Book

Stormbreaker begins with tragedy for young Alex Rider. Orphaned at a young age, he has been raised by his uncle Ian Rider. They were close, more like friends than uncle and nephew. So, when the police bring in the news that Ian Rider has been killed in a car crash, Alex is left feeling numb, unable to comprehend that he will never see his uncle again.

Alex and the housekeeper discuss the accident. They are surprised by the information that Ian Rider was not wearing a seatbelt, for he was always a careful man. Alex is dissatisfied with the official version of the accident, as he feels there is something more to it.

He eventually discovers that his uncle was a spy working on a mission for MI6, the British Intelligence Agency. He was assassinated because he had uncovered vital information. MI6, in a desperate move, drafts Alex and sends him to a training camp, to be trained for duty to take over where his uncle left off.

Alex has to spy on a man called Herod Sayle. Sayle’s company is making a new kind of revolutionary computer called Stormbreaker. Sayle plans to give one Stormbreaker to each secondary school across the UK. Alex is to take the place of a boy who won a competition to visit the plant. After a training period that proves pretty uncomfortable because his adult co-trainees dislike the idea of a boy in their midst, Alex is sent on the job. His only weapons are a grappling hook made to look like a yo-yo, a Game Boy Color and acne cream.

He visits Sayle’s mansion, which among other things, has a large aquarium that holds a huge Man o’War Jellyfish. Alex sees some suspicious activities going in the base, and investigates further. He soon learns about a horrible plot.

The donation of Stormbreaker computers hides a terrible hidden agenda. It is now up to Alex and his ingenuity to stop the plan and prevent a nationwide disaster. And, Alex is alone, in a race against time and against powerful enemies.

Stormbreaker was made into a movie in 2006.

About Anthony Horowitz

Anthony Horowitz is an English novelist and screenwriter.

Groosham Grange, The Falcon's Malteser, The Greek Who Stole Christmas, Public Enemy Number Two, Alex Rider: Secret Weapon, Point Blank, Snakehead, Eagle Strike, and Crocodile Tears are a few of his other books.

Anthony Horowitz wanted to be a writer from age eight. He was born in 1955 in London. His first published book was The Sinister Secret of Frederick K Bower, a humorous novel for young children. He is also a popular screenwriter, having written the script for many episodes of Agatha Christie’s Poirot and Midsomer Murders. He is also the creator and writer for the shows, Foyle’s War, Injustice and Collision. He is married to Jill Green and he has two children.

Title: Alex Rider Mission 3: Skeleton Key
Author: অ্যান্টনি হরোউইটয্
Summary: Teenage superspy Alex Rider is enlisted by the national security services again - this time for a routine reconnaissance mission at the Wimbledon Tennis Championships. But before long, Alex finds himself caught up in a terrifying chain of events that leads from the Chinese Triad gangs in London to an undercover assignment in Cuba. Alex begins to make chilling links between suspicious deaths, an illegal nuclear weapons deal and the plans of his host, Russian General Sarov, for the future of the world...

Title: Alex Rider Mission 8: Crocodile Tears

Summary: Ten million Alex Rider books sold worldwide. Other Alex Rider missions: \'Snakehead\', \'Stormbreaker\', \'Point Blanc\', \'Skeleton Key\', \'Eagle Strike\', \'Scorpia\' and \'Ark Angel\'.

Title: Judy Moody : Declares Independence No 6
Author: মেগান এমসিডোন্যাল্ড
Summary: Sixth instalment in the internationally popular and bestselling series (10 million Judy Moody books in print worldwide; translated into 22 languages). After learning about the American Revolution Judy Moody's in the mood for liberty and freedom - freedom from her parents' rules and her pesky little brother that is.

Title: Judy Moody : And The Bad Luck Charm No 11
Author: মেগান এমসিডোন্যাল্ড
Summary:
Heavily illustrated chapter book with generous leading, compact trim and sizable type makes this an inviting choice for reluctant readers, while the humour, language and subject matter are within reach of a skilled and newly independent reader. A funny look at what's luck, what's coincidence and what's just plain hard work.

Will Judy's lucky penny lead her to the nation's capital - or to C-A-L-A-M-I-T-Y? And what do her spelling-bee nemesis and a pot-bellied pig have to do with it? The lucky penny in Judy Moody's pocket sure does seem to be working. She can't stop winning - at bowling, spelling, the unbeatable Prize Claw, everything! For sure and absolute positive, she'll ride that wave of good fortune all the way to Washington, DC. Watch out, District of Cool, here comes Judy Moody, the luckiest kid ever, until...oh no! Her lucky penny just did a belly flop into a porcelain bowl of yucky, blucky UN- luck. Has the coin's magic gone kerflooey? Are some people, like Jessica Finch or Stink, destined to have all the luck, while she, Judy Moody, gets stuck with a garden full of three-not-four-leaf clovers, a squealing pot-bellied pig in an elevator and a squashed penny with cooties? ROAR!
Book_Title: Judy Moody : And The Bad Luck Charm No 11
